Title: Trump threatens military action in Nigeria over ‘killing of Christians’
Summary: President Donald Trump threatens to send US forces into Nigeria with ‘guns-a-blazing’ if Nigeria does not stem what he described as the killing of Christians by Islamists . In an explosive post on his Truth Social Media page, Trump threatens military action in Nigeria over 'killing of Christians'

Title: Hilda Baci shines on Lagos Fashion Week runway
Summary: Celebrity chef Hilda Baci shines on Lagos Fashion Week runway . The two-time Guinness World Record holder — for the Longest Cooking Marathon (2023) and Biggest Pot of Jollof Rice — shines on runway .

Title: FG pledges to release N11.995b arrears to doctors, other health workers within 72 hours
Summary: Federal Government pledges to release N11.995b arrears to doctors, other health workers within 72 hours . Dr Muhammad Suleiman, President of Nigeria, said the government will release the money within the next 72 hours for the payment .

Title: Bandits attack Kano communities, kill three villagers
Summary: A fresh invasion by bandits has unsettled several communities in Shanono and Tsanyawa Local Government Areas of Kano State, leaving three innocent villagers killed .

Title: Doctors’ strike: FG to release ₦11.9b to clear outstanding arrears
Summary: The Federal Government is set to release the sum of ₦11.995 billion within 72 hours to clear the outstanding arrears owed medical doctors . The Federal Ministry of Health & Social Welfare made this known through a circular .

Title: Nigerians groan as FG, states, LGs ‘smile to the bank’
Summary: Nigerians groan as FG, states, LGs ‘smile to the bank’ “The economic context remains troubling, with inflation currently at 18.2 percent and millions of households struggling to afford basic needs”

Title: Shrinking Opposition: Tinubu not behind govs, NASS members’ serial defections to APC
Summary: President Bola Tinubu not behind govs, NASS members’ serial defections to APC . Top administration official reveals •Says defectors ‘are coming partly because the President is very fair and nice to them’•Reps minority leadership blows hot, threatens legal and parliamentary measures to challenge them .

Summary: "I am hereby instructing our Department of War to prepare for possible action," he said . "If we attack, it will be fast, vicious, and sweet"

Title: ‘Nigeria protects citizens of all faiths,’ Tinubu reacts to Trump’s comments
Summary: Tinubu: "Nigeria stands firmly as a democracy governed by constitutional guarantees of religious liberty" "Nigerian citizens of all faiths"

Title: 9 people suffer life-threatening injuries in UK train stabbing
Summary: Counter-terrorism police are involved in an investigation into a mass stabbing on a train in eastern England which left nine people suffering with life-threatening injuries . A man with a large knife is believed to have been shot with a Taser by police after going on a bloody rampage .

Title: EPL: New Liverpool signings need time to adapt, says Salah
Summary: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah has called for patience as the club’s new signings continue to settle into the team . Salah acknowledged that while the squad has been strengthened with quality additions, the process of building understanding on the pitch takes time . Liverpool ended its four-game losing streak in the Premier League as Salah scored his 250

Title: Rumoured coup plot: N11bn found in detained colonel’s bank accounts
Summary: Military intelligence traced about N11bn to the bank accounts of a colonel detained over the alleged coup plot . The colonel claimed that the funds belonged to a former governor, whom he described as his business partner . Defence Intelligence Agency began tracking communications, financial movements, and foreign contacts linked to the suspects months before any arrests were made .

Title: APC seeks Soludo’s probe over cash-for-votes pledge
Summary: The APC’s National Secretary, Ajibola Bashiru, made the call in an interview with Sunday PUNCH . He accused Soludo of attempting to influence voters through financial inducement instead of relying on his administration's performance . Title: Electricity: 10,000MW locked up in idle plants, says power minister
Summary: Nigeria's Minister of Power, Adebayo Adelabu, decried the country’s wastefulness in the energy sector . He lamented that several government-built assets worth billions have been left idle for years . The minister said the country's immediate problem was not generation but the inability to transmit and distribute the energy already

Title: Tertiary institutions’ health workers shun strike
Summary: Health workers in medical centres across the countries’ universities, polytechnics, and colleges of education have distanced themselves from the ongoing industrial action declared by the National Association of Resident Doctors .
